intro: Ledothamnus guyanensis subsp. tatei, commonly known as the Guyana ledothamnus, is a shrub native to South America, particularly found in regions of Guyana and Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value. The subspecies tatei is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to other subspecies of Ledothamnus.
